definition:
Let $\alpha$ be a rectifiable, Jordan curve in $\mathbb{R}^{2}$ and
$z_{0}$ be a point in $\mathbb{R}^{2} - \operatorname{Im}(\alpha)$ and
let $\alpha$ have a winding number $W [ \alpha : z_{0} ]$. Then
$W [ \alpha : z_{0} ] = \pm 1$; all points inside $\alpha$ will have the
same index and we define the **orientation** of a Jordan curve $\alpha$
by saying that $\alpha$ is **positively oriented** if the index of every
point in $\alpha$ is $+1$ and **negatively oriented** if it is $-1$.
